metadata.title: CVE-2022-34471 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When downloading an update for an addon, the downloaded addon update'sversion was not verified to match the version selected from the manifest.If the manifest had been tampered with on the server, an attacker couldtrick the browser into downgrading the addon to a prior version. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 102.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
